title: How to Record Application Audio With Soundflower

steps.headline: Download Soundflower from http://code.google.com/p/soundflower/ Once there you should click on the Soundflower-1.5.1.dmg link under the featured downloads section of the web page to begin your download.
steps.description: Wait for the download to finish.

steps.headline: Open the .dmg file and click on the file titled Soundflower to begin the installation process.
Follow the install prompts by clicking on the continue option at each step.
steps.description: You must enter your password when prompted to proceed. Once you have entered your password the installation should finish on its own.

steps.headline: Configure System Audio.
steps.description: Go to system preferences and click the sound pane. Under the Output tab of the sound pane select Soundflower (2ch) as your sound device.

steps.headline: Configure Soundflower.
Download Audacity.
steps.description: Go to http://audacity.sourceforge.net/download/mac Download the version of audacity which is appropriate for your hardware.

steps.headline: Install Audacity.
steps.description: Open the .dmg you downloaded in step 6. Drag the Audacity Application to where you wish to store it on your computer.

steps.headline: Configure Audacity.
Start playing audio in a properly configured application.
steps.description: Configuration will vary slightly from application to application you must ensure that the application in question uses either system audio or has Soundflower (2ch) selected as its audio device. Your browser should work with the outlined settings without any need for configuration as such testing your setup should work if start playing a video (with sound) in Youtube before you proceed to the next step.

steps.headline: Start recording in audacity.
steps.description: Press the big red button on the main screen to begin recording. Enjoy the ability to record any sound on your computer!

tyn: A computer running Mac Os X
sentences: Download Soundflower from http://code.google.com/p/soundflower/ Once there you should click on the Soundflower-1.5.1.dmg link under the featured downloads section of the web page to begin your download.
Wait for the download to finish.
Open the .dmg file and click on the file titled Soundflower to begin the installation process.
Follow the install prompts by clicking on the continue option at each step.
You must enter your password when prompted to proceed.
Once you have entered your password the installation should finish on its own.
Configure System Audio.
Go to system preferences and click the sound pane.
Under the Output tab of the sound pane select Soundflower (2ch) as your sound device.
Configure Soundflower.
Open the Soundflowerbed Application.
It should be located in the Soundflower folder which should be in your Applications folder.
A black icon resembling a flower should appear in the top right hand corner of the screen near the system time.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/07\/Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-5Bullet2-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-5Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/07\/Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-5Bullet2-Version-2.jpg\/aid798829-v4-728px-Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-5Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Ensure that Soundflower (2ch) is selected as the default and system output under the Audio Devices tab.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/df\/Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-5Bullet3-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-5Bullet3-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/d\/df\/Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-5Bullet3-Version-2.jpg\/aid798829-v4-728px-Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-5Bullet3-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Before moving on make sure that you have selected Speakers/Headphone under the Sunflower bed drop down menu.
This will allow you to hear audio playback as you record it in later steps.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/33\/Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-5Bullet4.jpg\/v4-460px-Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-5Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/3\/33\/Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-5Bullet4.jpg\/aid798829-v4-728px-Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-5Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Download Audacity.
Go to http://audacity.sourceforge.net/download/mac Download the version of audacity which is appropriate for your hardware.
Install Audacity.
Open the .dmg you downloaded in step 6.
Drag the Audacity Application to where you wish to store it on your computer.
Configure Audacity.
Launch Audacity.
A dialogue box titled 'Audacity First Run' will appear.

Ensure that the language you want audacity to use is selected and press ok.{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/79\/Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-8Bullet1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-8Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/79\/Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-8Bullet1-Version-2.jpg\/aid798829-v4-728px-Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-8Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Go to the drop down menu titled Audacity and select preferences.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/53\/Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-8Bullet2-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-8Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/5\/53\/Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-8Bullet2-Version-2.jpg\/aid798829-v4-728px-Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-8Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} In the Audio I/O tab ensure that Soundflower (2ch) is selected as the recording device.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5e\/Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-8Bullet3-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-8Bullet3-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/5\/5e\/Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-8Bullet3-Version-2.jpg\/aid798829-v4-728px-Record-Application-Audio-With-Soundflower-Step-8Bullet3-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Start playing audio in a properly configured application.
Configuration will vary slightly from application to application you must ensure that the application in question uses either system audio or has Soundflower (2ch) selected as its audio device.

Your browser should work with the outlined settings without any need for configuration as such testing your setup should work if start playing a video (with sound) in Youtube before you proceed to the next step.
Start recording in audacity.
Press the big red button on the main screen to begin recording.
Enjoy the ability to record any sound on your computer!
